oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tamme (XII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Words and sentences contributed by Tamme (and occasionally by !nanni). They include many references to personal experiences. These include the people of their country, information about their relations and early childhood memories, as well as numerous names and descriptions of plants and animals (mostly in relation to food and eating). There are also many songs and the names of various !kun known by the boys. |han=kass'o provides many |xam equivalents to various !kun words. 1) Date on p.9141: 10 October 1879; p.9223: 7 January, 2) p.9145v: see The song of the =ne=nebbi (woodpigeon), 2) 9151v: see The song of the sauko, 3) p.9152v: see The song of the =na=n'arro, 4) p.9156v: see The names of !nanni's relations, 5) p.9181v: (8 December 1879) see A song of the sun Bushmen, 6) p.9183v: see Different peoples and Bushmen in !nanni and Tamme's country, 7) p.9191v: see The song of the ||gani (a bird), 8) p.9197v: see About Tamme's relations, 9) p.9223v: see Different peoples and Bushmen in !nanni and Tamme's country, 10) This is found in Book XI & XII-3.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd !kun notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Words and sentences: given by Tamme
